Key Match Events: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler hammered brilliant unbeaten half-centuries
Miscellaneous Highlights: England can now become the first team to hold both global trophies in white-ball cricket when they meet Pakistan in Sunday’s final at the Melbourne Cricket Ground
Others: Chris Jordan picked up three wickets
Suryakumar Yadav smashed a six and four off Stokes
KL Rahul began with a cracking boundary off Ben Stokes
Seamer Chris Woakes had Rahul caught behind off a rising delivery for five
Virat Kohli made his fourth half-century of the tournament and put on a 61-run fourth-wicket stand with Pandya
Adil Rashid ended a 43-run partnership when Sharma mistimed to wide long-on with the score on 57
Kohli, who leads the tournament batting chart with 296 runs, reached 50 off 39 balls but fell next delivery to a sharp catch at short third man by Rashid off Jordan
Pandya smashed four fours and five sixes before treading on his stumps to be out hit wicket off Jordan’s final ball of the innings
